Function Documentation

cb_uint32 cbWLAN_OS_getTicks ( cbWLAN_OS_REPrivHandle *  hWlan  ) 

Get millisecond resolution tick from WLAN_OS execution environment (EE).

Incrementing time tick from EE. The cb_uint32 is allowed to wrap.

Parameters:
hWlan WLAN component handle registered in cbWLAN_OS_register
Returns:
Millisecond resolution system tick.

void cbWLAN_OS_interrupt (  ) 

void cbWLAN_OS_ISRHandler ( void *  hCallback  ) 

cb_boolean cbWLAN_OS_isSynchronized ( cbWLAN_OS_REPrivHandle *  hWlan  ) 

Check if the EE is currently active or inactive.

Used in cases where the WLAN component need to check whether it is an initial call or a reentrant call (i.e. originating from a callback).

Parameters:
hWlan WLAN component handle registered in cbWLAN_OS_register
Returns:
TRUE if synchronized, FALSE otherwise.

cbRTSL_Status cbWLAN_OS_register ( cbWLAN_OS_REPrivHandle *  hWlan,
cbWLAN_OS_TickCallback  tick 
)

Registers WLAN component with the WLAN_OS execution environment (EE).

Note:
The EE is expected to call the tick function every ~100ms in order to feed the internal timers in WLAN component. Before calling the tick function, the EE callback lock must be acquired.
See also:
cbWLAN_OS_synchronize
Parameters:
hWlan Pointer to struct containing necessary WLAN references.
tick Pointer to timer tick callback.
Returns:
Should return cbSTATUS_OK if successful, otherwise cbSTATUS_ERROR.

void cbWLAN_OS_SL_acquire ( cbWLAN_OS_REPrivHandle *  hWlan  ) 

Acquire a second level lock.

Can be implemented as a spinlock or a mutex. If a preemptive system is used and cbWLAN_OS_synchronize is implemented to handle it, this may even be left empty. This function shall never be called recursively, i.e. only one lock instance need to be available.

Parameters:
hWlan WLAN component handle registered in cbWLAN_OS_register

void cbWLAN_OS_SL_release ( cbWLAN_OS_REPrivHandle *  hWlan  ) 

Release a second level lock.

See also:
cbWLAN_OS_SL_acquire
Parameters:
hWlan WLAN component handle registered in cbWLAN_OS_register

cbRTSL_Status cbWLAN_OS_synchronize ( cbWLAN_OS_REPrivHandle *  hWlan,
cbWLAN_OS_SynchronizedCallback  func,
void *  data 
)

"Tunnel" a function call through the WLAN_OS execution environment (EE).

Note:
The EE may not queue the function call, it must be done immediately. Because of the design of the WLAN component, a semaphore or similar locking mechanism must be used. This lock must be acquired before calling the callback function.
Parameters:
hWlan WLAN component handle registered in cbWLAN_OS_register
func Callback function pointer.
data Anonymous data pointer that should be passed back to func.
Returns:
Return value of func should be passed back as return value.

cbRTSL_Status cbWLAN_OS_unregister ( cbWLAN_OS_REPrivHandle *  hWlan  ) 

Unregisters WLAN component with the WLAN_OS execution environment.

Parameters:
hWlan WLAN component handle registered in cbWLAN_OS_register
Returns:
Should return cbSTATUS_OK if successful, otherwise cbSTATUS_ERROR.
